briefTitle: Carotid and Vertebral Magnetic Resonance Angiography (MRA) Study Comparing Dotarem and Time Of Flight (TOF)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male or female, aged more than 18 years
* Strongly suspected of having carotid or vertebral arterial disease
* Scheduled (or to be scheduled) to undergo computed tomography angiography (CTA) examination

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known grade IV or V chronic kidney disease (GFR\<30 mL/min/1.73m²)
* Contraindication to MRI
* Acute renal dysfunction within the 6 months preceding Dotarem®-enhanced MRA examination

outcomeMeasures.title: Technical Failure Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of non-assessable arterial segments as measured by 3 independent readers in off-site evaluation of TOF-MRA and Dotarem-enhanced MRA (re-read DGD-44-061).

outcomeMeasures.title: Sensitivity
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of true stenotic segments (i.e. with stenosis \>= 70%) of TOF and Dotarem-enhanced MRA evaluated by 3 independent off-site readers at the segment level, with CTA as standard of truth (re-read DGD-44-061).

outcomeMeasures.title: Specificity
outcomeMeasures.description: Rate of true non-stenotic segments (i.e. without stenosis \>= 70%) of TOF and Dotarem-enhanced MRA evaluated by 3 independent off-site readers at the segment level, with CTA as standard of truth (re-read DGD-44-061).
